Need to filter out rows where any of the questions has grade greater than 7 (filter for data after and including 1979).
Need to filter out award values that are neither of gold, silver, bronze, honourbale mention, or NA (no award).

```{r}
url <- 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2024/2024-09-24/individual_results_df.csv'
individual_results_df <- read_csv(url, col_types=cols(p7=col_double())) |>
    select(-p7, -total, -individual_rank)

# head(individual_results_df)
# nrow(individual_results_df)
# unique(individual_results_df$award)
# filter(individual_results_df, award == "Special prize")
individual_results_tidy <- individual_results_df |>
  filter(year >= 1979) |>
  filter(!if_any(p1:p6, is.na)) |>
  filter(award == "Gold medal" | award == "Silver medal" |
         award == "Bronze medal" | award == "Honourable mention" |
         is.na(award))
```

```{r}
nrow(individual_results_tidy)
unique(individual_results_tidy$award)
```
```{r}
ggplot(individual_results_tidy, aes(x = p1)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 0:7)
```


```{r}
suppressPackageStartupMessages(require(rstan))
brazil_simple_predict <- stan_model("./brazil_simple_model.stan")
```

```{r}
fit = sampling(
  brazil_simple_predict,
  data = list(N = nrow(brazil_results), y = brazil_results$total_awards),
  chains = 1,
  iter = 10000,
  seed = 123
)
```
```{r}
print(fit)
```
```{r}
ci_limits <- data.frame(lower = numeric(), upper = numeric())
ci_limits <- rbind(ci_limits, data.frame(lower = 0, upper = 0)) # Dummy first row

for (i in 2:nrow(brazil_results)) {
  N_train = i - 1
  if (N_train == 1) {
    ys = array(brazil_results$total_awards[1:N_train], dim = 1)
  } else {
    ys = brazil_results$total_awards[1:N_train]
  }
  
  train_test_data = list(
      N = N_train,
      y = ys
  )
  
  fit = sampling(
    brazil_simple_predict,
    data = train_test_data,
    chains = 1,
    iter = 10000,
    refresh = 0, # To suppress running messages
    seed = 123
  )
  
  y_pred_samples = extract(fit, pars="y_predict")$y_predict
  limits = unname(quantile(y_pred_samples, probs = c(0.1, 0.9)))
  
  ci_limits <- rbind(ci_limits, data.frame(lower = limits[1], upper = limits[2]))
}
```

```{r}
merged_df = brazil_results |> 
  bind_cols(data.frame(CI_L = ci_limits[,1], CI_R = ci_limits[,2])) %>% 
  mutate(Inside_CI = (total_awards >= CI_L & total_awards <= CI_R)) 

merged_df[-1, ] %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = total_awards, ymin = CI_L, ymax = CI_R, color=Inside_CI)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_errorbar() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Year", y = "Total Awards")
```
